abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Grant Program for Malawi will be the second in a series of
            three annual programmatic development policy lending (DPL)
            operations that are aimed at supporting the
            government's reform program in the implementation of
            the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). As was
            the case with Poverty Reduction Support Credit (PRSC)-1, the
            PRSC-2 is being designed and implemented within a harmonized
            framework for the provision of budget support in Malawi.
            Such a framework exists under the leadership of the
            Government of Malawi (GoM) with five participating donors,
            including International Development Association (IDA).'
            It comprises of a joint framework, or memorandum of
            understanding, a multi-year Performance Assessment Framework
            (PAF), and a review process aimed at reducing transaction
            costs for all parties involved. The program document is
            divided into six sections, including this introduction.
            Section two discusses the country context which gives an
            overview of Malawi, recent economic developments including
            the impact of recent exogenous shocks, macroeconomic
            outlook, and debt sustainability. Section three presents the
            Government's program MGDS, section four discusses how
            the Bank is supporting the government program, while section
            five describes the second PRSC. Section six describes
            implementation issues, with a focus on risks and mitigating measures.
